content.description:
A worthy diversion from clipping bolts next door...

Climb up the face to the right of the big corner on plate-ish slabs with little overlaps.

Good gear to be had in the plates.

Use the anchor on Patina Pies or Really Sweet for the git off.

Might as well...
content.protection: Smattering of cams and stoppers from small to medium-ish.
content.location: The big corner under Patina Pies and left of Really Sweet.

climbs.name: Tiramisu
climbs.fa: Brian Cabe, Dale Ralphs and Dottie Cross 10 June 2007

content.description: Nearly a sport route, Tiramisu is great for aspiring 5.7 trad leaders, or, even jaded old timers looking for a nice route.  Crux is a thin move past the upper crack that is followed for a short distance.  Requires either a 70 or 80 meter rope to rappel, or, down climb the low angle slot to the chimney (take care!) if you have a single 60 meter rope.  Also note that you cannot lower a climber to the ground with a single 60 meter rope (so, bad candidate for a TR too).
content.protection: 9 lead bolts and medium to large nuts and a couple of medium cams for the crack after the fifth bolt (completely reduces the run out between the fifth and sixth bolt:  pro it up!).  Bolted anchor located above the final face climbing to the right of the other bolted anchor (which will probably be more visible).  Note that both anchors are more than 30 meters from the ground, but, a single 60m rope "could" be used to rappel if you don't mind down climbing the low angle slot and short chimney at the start of the climb.  Please watch your rope ends and be cafeful if you rappel on a single 60m rope on this and all climbs on this face!
content.location: Take the well-built and obvious trail to the base of the north end of the west face of Fence Line Rock.  Start up a fairly easy chimney to the right of the staging area for the routes on that face.  Look for the line of bolts to the right of Crème Brûlée (face climb above the thin flake at the entrance to said low angle chimney/slot).  Follow the low angle slot up (protection available as small cams) and clip the first bolt on the large hold.

content.description:
A fun route with varied features.

Start on a thin smooth slab, left of a right facing crack slab, or, climb the crack.  Smooth face up to dishy bucket features.

Trend right up nice edges.  Up high, cross a couple of wide cracks to the summit ridge.
content.protection: Standard trad rack.  Anchor on Tiramisu.
content.location:
Located just right of Pop Tart and left of Odoriferous Harmony.

Rappel route with something longer than a 60m rope.  Or, use two ropes.

content.description:
A fun little jaunt which milks the big features and fixed anchors enroute to the crest of the Fenceline ridgeline.

Start at the north end of the formation, and, climb weaknesses crossing back and forth to keep the grade reasonable.

Can clip a number of anchors for protection.
content.protection: Standard rack and some long slings for keeping rope drag down (route wanders in and out of chunky features).
content.location:
On the far north end of the formation.  The route is basically the skyline starting on the far left side of the west face and following the crest of the ridge.

Can rappel from the Tiramisu anchor (70m rope).

content.description: This is one of the easiest bolted climbs at Castle, and it's quality too. 5 bolts to chain anchors on a big ledge.  Great place to take kids or beginners. It makes a good warmup if you're headed up to The Taco or Comp Rock too.
content.location: Towards the right side of Fenceline Rock if looking at it from the Taco area. This route is just to the right of a huge right facing corner. It climbs up a bit of slab and then some cool looking patina.

content.protection: Bolts with an option for large cams to protect the horazontals at the top.  I used a #2 and #3 camalot.  Chain anchors.
Bolts and an option small cam or tcu can be used to transition from the lower facr to the upper face. I used a #0 tcu.  Chain ancors.
content.location: Between Borderline and South of the Border.  See Topo.

content.description:
An easier gear option on the west side of Fenceline.

Climb up the trough past the start of Tiramisù.  Head up on nice big features to the crack below the orange face (clipping the sole bolt on the way).  Follow the crack up and left.  Continue up to the anchor on Tiramisù.

Nice rock.

Suggest belaying at the top.  Cannot lower safely with a single 60m rope!  Might be able to lower with an 80m rope.
content.protection:
Standard rack of gear plus one bolt.

Two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Located to the right of Tiramisù and ending at that routes anchor.

Rappel route (with two 50/60m ropes) or a single 70m rope (take care!).

climbs.name: Pockets Full of Sand
climbs.fa: Brian Cabe and Chris Harmston April 2007

content.description: East face of Fenceline, climb up short, steep left leaning crack.  Face climb and/or traverse to lower angle right slanting crack which is followed up until its end.  Traverse left and finish up wider crack to chockstone on summit ridge.  See route topo photo.
content.protection: Standard rack of gear.  Use fixed anchor on Tiramisu and/or chockstone (add long sling to chockstone).
content.location: Located on the east face of Fenceline.  Look for a slightly left slanting finger crack below a small pine tree.  Rappel west face from Tiramisu anchor with a single 70 meter rope (see route description of Tiramisu for more details).

content.description: This route goes up the arête just left of Really Sweet. There are three bolts close to the ground, then two more bolts up towards the top separated by highly featured 5.easy terrain in the middle that you can either run out or place some gear.
content.protection: Bolts to chains. If you take a few large stoppers you can protect the middle section, but they're definitely not needed if you can handle an easy runout.
content.location: Look for the huge right facing corner on Fenceline Rock. This route is just barely left of the corner. For reference, Really Sweet is the route to the right of this corner.

content.description:
A fun little jaunt with good rock and fairly good protection.

Start just left of the wide crack flake and move up right into a thin crack.  Go up to lower angle terrain, then up the shallow trough to the anchor on Tiramisu.

Protection:  Standard rack of trad gear.  No bolts except the anchor at the top.

Location:  to the right of South of the Border (and the bolted sports route Pop Tart) and to the left of Creme Brulee.

Pick one of three starts (left - finger crack layback, right - short hand crack in corner, middle - short overhanging hand crack).  Middle crack is recommended.  All three variations for the start are approximately 5.8 in difficulty.

From the low angle slab past the short, intial steep section, aim for the thin crack that is straight up the face, which cuts through the summit ridge.  Horizontal cracks, up over laps, then up to thin crack.  Follow crack up then slightly right to finish on slightly overhanging rock.
content.protection: Standard rack with three protection bolts on the upper portion of the route.  Fixed rappel anchor at top, just below ridge crest and climber's left of the crack.
content.location:
East side of Fenceline rock.  At the base of the middle of the low angle slab (on the right-most side of the east face), look for the thin crack which bisects the ridge line on top of formation.

Rappel route.  70m rope works for this rappel, or, angle over to the climber's right and down climb trough/shallow low angle chimney.

content.description:
Start below the small tree/shrub on the start of the ledge to the left of Really Fun.  Climb up and clip a protection bolt, then, passing the tree, use the crack for pro.

At near where the crack goes over to horizontal, step up, clip a bolt, make some steep moves, clip another bolt then step up and finish at the anchor.

A fun little diversion...
content.protection:
Three lead bolts and supplemental pro for the crack (small to medium cams).

Fixed anchor.
content.location:
Located 20+ left of Really Fun.  Locate the curving crack with the small tree on its left side.

Fixed anchor:  rappel route.

content.description:
An unrecommended route recorded for historical avoidance.

Route climbs face next to a sensitive and fragile moss runnel and finishes on the big corner right of Really Fun.
content.protection:
Standard rack.

Anchor for Really Fun works for the top of this route.
content.location:
Located between Really Fun and Pop Tart.

Route climbs up a face with a moss runnel and finishes at the anchor for Really Fun.

content.description: AKA: Redball Project, recently renamed, I just got back from City and Castle and was told that this beauty was freed at the end of last season. The consensus seems to be 12-. Climb the bouldery start with small pro and finish on the upper flaring section. Finishes with insecure fingers or layback to a good jug.
content.protection: 000 c3s and the smallest stoppers. Small tcus and other cams
content.location: East side of fenceline. obvious and to the right of a bolted 10.c
